thread.title: Seattle Seahawks Monday injury report: Nine players sit out
thread.title_full: Seattle Seahawks Monday injury report: Nine players sit out

author: Bob Condotta
title: Seattle Seahawks Monday injury report: Nine players sit out
text:
Unlimited Digital Access. $1 for 4 weeks. 
Others who were declared as not being able to participate are: T Garry Gilliam (ankle), C Patrick Lewis (ankle), DE Cliff Avril (ankle), DE Frank Clark (hamstring), LB Brock Coyle (knee), DT Jordan Hill (quadriceps), LB Nick Moody (ankle) and DT Demarcus Dobbs (shoulder). 
Avril, one of the team’s most productive players, was injured late in the 27-23 loss to Carolina Sunday. 
Five more players were listed as limited: G Justin Britt (hip), WR Tyler Lockett (hip), S Kam Chancellor (shoulder), CB Richard Sherman (ankle), LB Bobby Wagner (pectoral). 
The injuries to Chancellor and Sherman are new, while coach Pete Carroll said he is hopeful that Wagner will be able to play against the 49ers. 
Two players were listed as full participants: RB Marshawn Lynch (hamstring) and CB Tye Smith (hip) who each are expected to play against the 49ers. 
Bob Condotta : 206-515-5699 or bcondotta@seattletimes.com ; on Twitter: @bcondotta . Bob Condotta covers the Seahawks for the Seattle Times. He provides daily coverage of the team throughout the year.
